CHARLES.raw_line: I was thinking that, about the coffin.Try a Goddamn turkey roll and you'll discover how. They're delicious.Bet Joe's not gonna wanna do my movie anymore.Why do you think why? The story. It's about the living dead.But she's dead, shithead.Told you.That was the longest day ever-- here.New scene, check it out. Let's hit the 7.I know, does that guy ever not barf? Keep reading.I think it might help make my movie better. I need two things: a better story and production value.No way -- did I tell you what she did with my top hat?Alice Dainard.I was returning that book on codes and ciphers-- she was in the silent reading section -- I thought, "Screw it." So I asked her if she'd play Hathaway's wife.She said yes, we're filming tonight and she's driving.Jesus, Freak Show, she offered to drive and I accepted--Maybe she just wants to be in a good movie, y'ever think of that?I've been working on this movie for months. I'm just trying to make it good.... what?Who gives a rat's ass what she was reading-- the festival deadline's in one week -- my movie's gotta be great!Yeah, but it's not a st-- thank you for that-- it's not a story yet.Older kids enter this film festival -- I'm competing with fifteen- and sixteen-year-olds, who have better stories and cars and production value, I've got nothing!I'm coming! There's a whole article in there about stories, you should read it, it explains everything.You're impossible.Read this.Because you crushed Charles' top hat, you ever think of that?Guess what, no we're not.Later days.Okay, it's time -- don't get caught, over.Wanna hear something gross?I sneezed so hard yesterday I shit my pants. I debated telling you.Twizzler me.Martin? I don't see how the guy playing Detective Hathaway can ask where the zombies are coming from.Make-up, sound and special effects.You want Joe to-- stay back? I--?So I wrote a couple new lines, can I show you?Shut up. There aren't a lot--What would be great is: could you cry during the scene? Can you do that?Shut up.Guys, there's an electrical socket up here.No. But you can pick up some stuff.Guys, this is going to be great. Get the lights and camera on that end, we'll shoot this direction first, like we talked about! Joe, get the mike plugged in-- make sure the new batteries are in the camera before you do the make-up!Martin, I have a new line for you.So this is very emotional.Alice: Mrs. Hathaway really doesn't want her husband to keep investiga--Okay, I'm just directing. Martin get on your mark. Martin, you're going to have to reassure her. Do you know what "reassure her" means?Okay-- we're starting on Alice's side first-- Preston: a couple seconds after "action" walk to the pay phone, make it look like this place is busy--Asshole, could you stop blowing shit up for two seconds and deal with the camera?Let's rehearse this -- save your real performances for when we're filming, though.Ready? Here we go... action!-- uh, that was... I'm... that-- yeah, good. Just like that.PRODUCTION VALUE!!! Is there film in the camera?!PUT IT IN!!! PUT IT IN!!! Joe, get the mike ready. Go, go, Preston, get in position. Costume, costume. Martin, get that tripod set up. Joe, help her with her costume. Hurry, hurry! Go! I hope we don't miss the train. Preston, get in position! Martin, you know you lines, right?! IS THE FILM IN THE CAMERA YET?!Everyone ready...?! Be extra loud when the train passes by! Oh God, I hope it stops! You ready?!And... ACTION!Joe, we have to go.I DON'T WANT TO DIE!!!I'm alive! Is anyone dead?What is this stuff?They look like white Rubik's cubes or something. They're heavy like metal or something. There's like a billion of them.What? Driving on the tracks?-- is that him?Remember when Old Man Woodward took your Electronic Football?Dr. Woodward! It's Charles Kaznyk! From fourth period! You've been in an accident!Oh shit, all the glass just fell out!Great, the focus ring just fell off!Can you believe this?It's on the news. That means it's real.... oh my God, Joe... that's AWESOME--We can use this -- we can film it --If any of the footage from last night is usable, that means we need Alice to play the wife again.She was mint, but she's never gonna do it.There's no way. You heard what she said.You honestly think she cares about the scenes?Man, did you hear what she said last night? "I never should have done this!" Dude, she was totally wigged!Did you see her face?Man, what's wrong with you?Lens is cracked. Focus ring broke. Ya think it's fixable?We're screwed, man, it's over!We need this developed as soon as possible -- can you do overnight?... no, thank you.Well, what's the fastest you can do?I don't know.CUT! That was mint! So good! And it looked huge with the train! Wow! Joe: go reload the cap gun!We'll get the other direction next - - Alice, that was mint-- Martin, go a little faster next time.-- dude, what are you doing?Thanks, could I have a coffee, please? Cream on the side?Joe: stop talking about it.Please shut up, all of you.SHHHHJESUS! You heard what the Old Man said, we can't talk about this! -- thank you, very much.Funny, Chompers, at least I don't use a booster seat.I don't wanna find out -- guys, we gotta forget we were there. Joe, seriously... you really wanna take a chance that something could happen to your dad, too?Hey! So I'm gonna need more shots of the train crash, obviously-- you know that train model you made? Can we blow it up and film it?I don't wanna hear about it. They could be monitoring us right now! Jesus, shut up. Over!Joe -- YOU CAN NOT FLAKE OUT ON ME AND BE A DICK! Are you gonna come help me tomorrow or not? I need you to make Alice a zombie again.Guys, what the hell?! No one knew where you were.You gotta be the soldier.Evan blew us off, he's a pussy. Excuse me.You gotta do it. You're the only one.Shhhh! Production value! It's for the movie!Joe. Hey, Mr. Lamb!Uh-- Mr. Lamb? That's your camera, but technically, that's my film--I told you not to pick it up in the first place.That's part of it! Juts a part!My whole movie's a disaster `cause of you!Whatever.It's not about the movie.Just forget it.There's nothing wrong--It's not about the movie.Jesus, you don't even get it do you? It's obvious.Gawd, you're a dumb ass.That night of the crash, you started getting all weird.Like Mr. Attitude all of a sudden.Don't pretend like you did it for me! You didn't do it for me and you know it!It was never about me! It was always about Alice!Not so you could fall in love with her!Because I like her! That's why! That's why I asked her in the first place! So I could get to know her, not YOU!You're such an idiot.SHIT! Look at all that smoke! We can't use any of this. And you won't even let me blow up your train. Everything's bogus.I know it's stupid. What would she ever like me? I haven't leaned out yet, which the doctor says is gonna HAP---- Joe, what the hell--?!They made us get on the bus.You gonna tell him about that thing?Do this for me and I'll babysit the twins next week so you can go to Wendy's stupid party.I am not shitting you. You can't ask me any questions though. You can't tell anyone. I'm serious. No one.Yes or no, you ugly freak. I'm about to rescind the offer.You think Woodward's got information about that thing in the dungeon?I was thinking about that too.Yeah, Woodward has all kinds of weird stuff in the dungeon.I don't care. Disco I guess?Joe, let me try -- let me try.Joe, this is impossible, man.--I loosened it for you.I cannot believe we're breaking into school, who does that? No one does that-- idiots do that--Back when he was like Middle-Aged Man Woodward.I don't know. It says April 8th, 1963 incident. I dunno.He was trying to help it escape.-- oh shit!... what... what's gonna happen?Joe. They're not gonna kill us. You know why?Was that the thing from the train?!Was that it?! Oh my God!!!Oh my God, guys --What's that gun --?I don't feel good about this --FOR WHAT?! ANOTHER MONSTER?!?!-- I wanna go home so bad --I'm strong!You can do it!I just sharteezed a little.Congratulations!Joe, where are we going?TURN THE CAR AROUND!Where?!Oh shit, Martin, you gotta bone sticking out of your leg!Joe, gimme that thing on the curtains!... you gonna be okay without me?God, Cary. Shut up!This is going to hurt.I haven't even done it yet.

JACK.raw_line: Hey-- Lucy.I'll be home soon.That was a good zombie murder.Hey -- I'll be out in a minute--It's a six-week program, hands-on training with college coaches. You'll like it. I know I did.Things have obviously changed for us. And it'd be good for you to spend some time with kids who don't run around with-- cameras and MONSTER MAKE-UP--I have nothing against your friends. I like your friends.Except Cary, who can't stop lighting things on fire. You'll like it there. It's what we both need.As you can expect, the local authorities are trying to figure out just what happened here as well as how to help you out.Colonel, there isn't anything I should know, is there?I'd like to see that manifest, yes.Colonel, I've got a lot of people in my town that are gonna want to know what's taking place.... Lillian.They gave me the run around for two hours before I was allowed to talk to anyone.Nelec -- the Colonel -- refused to show me their manifest, said they were carrying mostly airplane parts-Sheriff, I'm telling you, there's something else going on -- they're taking molds of tire tracks -- now why would they be doing that? Who are they looking for? And they're packing these weird little cubes into crates and they're----yeah, into these red trucks, dozens of these trucks -- and I'm telling you, they're scrambling to get the hell outta there--Sheriff, I think you need to go check it out.Vicky, ya heard from Sheriff Pruitt this morning?Vicky, I need you to have Dayton send a CS unit out to Edie's. You put out an APB on the Sheriff and Breen Haskell -- send units to their houses immediately. You copy all of that?... what kind of unusual calls...?Having trouble with anyone lately, Izzy?That's not enough. People don't feel safe here -- and you know why? `Cause they're not---- the Air Force isn't answering a damn question: they've got trucks at Woodward's house, looking for SOMETHING --I know. They're saying it's just clean-up at the train crash, but they're taking molds of tire tracks. Which means they're looking for someone-- now what's that about?I'm sure she's around. I put a couple of slices in the fridge for you there.Vicky, you got power at the station?Get water and power out there now.Mrs. Babbit, I don't believe the Russians have anything to do with what's happening in town-- but I'm calling the curfew because w--We have good people working on that. Mr. McCandless.Mr. McCandless, can I speak with you for a moment, privately?Patty, get in touch with Vicky. David, have you seen Milner?Hey Tom. Tom, have you seen Milner?Check his office.--Rosko, I need you to get every radio we have and you tune to these frequencies -- understand?Hey Danny, you have a radio scanner with a descrambler don't you?Whatever, get it down and set it up for me.I think the Air Force is using UNASSIGNED CHANNELS--The hell do you mean you "found my dog in Brookville?" That's a DIFFERENT COUNTY--Walking Distance.Get in the car.Why are your trucks sweeping the town?Then I'm sure you wouldn't mind me contacting DC. Talk to some friends about "Walking Distance."All right. We'll do it that way.This is new. All this. For the both of us. Dealing with-- all this, just us. So I'm going to make this as clear and simple as I can: You're not friends with Alice Dainard. When I say no, I don't mean maybe. I don't mean yes. I mean no. I've known Louis Dainard for alotta years-- he's been nothing but trouble. Your mother used to say he's not a bad guy, he just needs a chance, he's just sad - - well I tried to be good to him, but I can't. Not anymore. I will not allow him or his daughter in this house. I will not allow you spending time with her, doing projects or whatever it is that you're doing. THAT'S IT. I hope we're clear.What'd you say?Joseph Francis Lamb--I'm not having this discussion with you--!I don't care what she is! Her father is a selfish, irresponsible son-of-a-bitch!You listen to me, I've got twelve thousand people in this town that are scared out of their minds-- they've got one person they can rely on -- it used to be someone else, but now it's just me.Hello--?--I'm here to see Colonel Nelec. He told me to meet him here.WHERE'S NELEC?Hey! I gotta take a leak! What am I supposed to do, piss in here?!Thanks for the hospitality.So am I going in alone or are y--?Hi, how are you doing?Shhhh.Rosko!--come here. The Air Force set that fire, they want the town empty for some reason. The whole military operation, the evacuation, everything is all bad.Tell me everything, right now, and I won't throw you in jail.Hey fellas, I've got orders from Colonel Nelec to personally transport this man to base.-- to find our kids.... It was an accident. It was an accident.-- I got you. I got you.

(waits, anxious, then,Yessir.-- what?OKAY --You mean why he crashed the train?That whole thing's an Air Force train.I make models-- plastic ones-- you know, glue `em, paint `em--Air Force trains -- even models -- have these hooks...Every car in that crash had hooks, every one...He had a gun, why not use that?Mostly the Dick Smith Monster Make- up Handbook.... sure.I don't care, they can blow it up. Lucy. Lucy!Lucy! ... Lucy!-- have you... seen Lucy?That's... okay, I'll find a--So the Air Force is looking for a car -- Alice's dad's car -- they're taking tire prints from the crash site. Over.And the military's at Woodward's house. Looking for his research. Whatever that means?Okay... I'll do the make-up. Over.Oh gawd, I didn't clean up.Yeah, that's the Hunchback of Notre Dame. I watched that one on TV. HERE---This is the train they wanna destroy.That's dry brush technique. After you've painted the base color, you take something like... Euro Gray.There are so many different grays, it's crazy. And you pour a little onto like a paper plate. Then you take a dry brush and you just dip it in, then you brush on the paper, so the paint's barely on the brush. Then you make small brush strokes on the model. Little ones, like where the wear and tear would be. Around the wheels. Or where the doors would slide. Then you do it again, like with Camouflage Gray-- or here, I used Insignia Red to make it look like there was another coat of paint on there before. Like they painted over it, but you could see it scratched off.My dad gave it to her the day I was born. She wears it all the time. Used to. It was bad, how she-- died and stuff, but they got the necklace back. So.We're sitting right here.I thought you were calling Evan.We're not clear.We're not clear. You and I aren't clear about anything. We couldn't be less clear.Just `cause mom died doesn't mean you know anything about me!!! You don't. You don't know about Alice either -- she's kind!She's NICE to me!Before, earlier, b-- no, you okay?Oh, you wanna come in?Room's still messy.He can be sorta li-- I've known him since Kindergarten, though---- no, I totally do, I'm just... sort of in shock at this whole CONVERSATION--... yeah...... it's so weird watching her like this, like she's still here... ... she used to look at me, this way... like really look. ALICE.raw_line: Joe Lamb?!What the hell's he doing here?He's the deputy's kid!Charles, I don't have a license. I can't drive with him!It's too late! He's seeing me in this car right now.Get in.What?I'm sorta trying to drive--... no...?!Stop.My dad works at the mill.I know, we read it, we get it.Was that okay? Or... not really?I love how calm he is.-- what's all that blood?What's the blood? -- did someone get hurt--?) -- yeah, it's him--Dr. Woodward...?... Dr. Woodward?-- we shouldn't be here--MOVE YOUR ASS, WE GOTTA GO!!!It's hard enough to drive without everyone yelling!We can't tell anyone we were there - - we can't say a thing about it -- my dad cannot find out I took his car, do you guys hear me?!Joe, this is yours.I should never have done this.Hi...Oh-- no. No, I'm done with that.I'm watching the crash on the news.I should go.I don't care what Charles wants-- I said no on the phone.And now you're at my house.It's too weird after last night-- I don't understand how you guys can keep working on your stupid movie, I really don't.No.You should go.He was just inviting me to a party.... what do you think happened...?I just got a horrible feeling.-- what?Keep going.So, if it's Air Force, what would the Air Force have on a train?Where'd you learn how to do this?So how am I supposed to be a zombie?For English? Yeah---- you made all these?... it looks real. It looks so old...Euro Gray...What was that necklace? The one you were holding at the train crash. Was it your mom's?It's okay.Yeah.Power's still out.I was in bed, couldn't sleep. Thinking. I wanted to tell you something, before tomorrow -- Don't let Charles blow up your train.I don't think it's right, do you? I know he's your friend, but he's so BOSSY--He shouldn't always get what he wants. I mean, who always gets what they want? -- I know I don't know you at all. Even though... it sort of feels like I do. Do you not... feel like that?-- no, keep it-- please --... is that her?He drank that morning. My dad. He missed his shift. Your mom took it for him. The day of the accident.... I know he wishes it was him. Instead of her. ... and sometimes I wish it was, too.I should go to bed.I don't want to sit down.What is this? What are you doing here?!How did you know?Really?It's been experimented on for years. It's terrified and exhausted and hungry, it just wants to go home. When it touched me, I knew --
